uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda
Class DataMonitor

java.lang.Object
  uk.ac.cf.cs.scm5mjw.mda.DataMonitor
All Implemented Interfaces:
CommunicationListener, SimulationListener
public final class DataMonitor
extends java.lang.Object
implements CommunicationListener, SimulationListener

This class handles obtaining data about a simulation (via events) and outputting it to a file. For correct functionality a DataMonitor must, at the least, be registered on a Simulator. Most importantly, two notifications from the observable Simulation are required: 1. Simulation Start: - Open an output stream - Start the XML document for output - Outputs information about the simulation ('metadata') 2. Simulation Finish: - End the XML document - Close the output stream Both of these are necessary for correct behaviour. If a finish notification is not received then the output file may not have been completed. Also, Simulator held in the SimulationEvent when the simulationStart is fired is used as the Simulator that is responsible for subsequent communication notifications. The file written to is determined by the file specified by the constructor or mutator method. On initiation, the output stream is established to this file. After this (until the finish notification), changes to the file are not legal. Note that this class is written so that it will not overwrite a file if it exists already. Instead, a new file with a unique name (based on the specified file) will be created and written to.

Constructor Detail

DataMonitor

public DataMonitor(java.io.File outF)
Construct a data monitor which will output to the given file. By default, the following are enabled: - Output of metadata (information about the simulation) - Output of successful sessions

Method Detail

setMonitorSessionSuccesses

public void setMonitorSessionSuccesses(boolean b)
A mutator to determine whether outputting of session successes during the simulation should be carried out.

An accessor to find out whether outputting of session successes during the simulation should be carried out.

A mutator to determine whether or not metadata (information about the simulation before it begins) should be outputted.

getOutputMetadata

public boolean getOutputMetadata()
An accessor to find out determine whether or not metadata (information about the simulation before it begins) should be outputted.

setOutputFile

public void setOutputFile(java.io.File outF)
A mutator for the output file. This is the file where the data will be written to. A file cannot be changed while the simulation is running.

getOutputFile

public java.io.File getOutputFile()
An accessor for the output file. This is the file where the data will be written to. Note that this is the ORIGINAL output file (not the renamed one). If a file is found to exist already, then ouput will go to a renamed file (so that the original is not overwritten).

simulationStarted

public void simulationStarted(SimulationEvent evt)
This method will handle the notification of beginning simulation. Note that this will store the Simulator in the SimulationEvent for use in other listener/notification methods.

simulationFinished

public void simulationFinished(SimulationEvent evt)
This method will handle the notification that a simulation has finished. Note that it is here that the locally held Simulator is unset (as it should not be needed anymore).

Specified by:
simulationFinished in interface SimulationListener

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

outputMetadata

private void outputMetadata()
                     throws org.xml.sax.SAXException
A method to handle outputting details about the simulation ('metadata'). This includes various parameters for the simulation, including: - The timestep length - A list of all the devices in the simulation - The date and time (in the real world) the simulation began executing

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException

org.xml.sax.SAXException

initiate

private void initiate()
               throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                      java.io.IOException,
                      DataOutputException
This method will set up the output and XML document for data to be added. In particular, it: - Opens an output stream to the file currently being specified - Starts the XML document - Begins the root element of the XML document

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException
DataOutputException

finish

private void finish()
             throws org.xml.sax.SAXException,
                    java.io.IOException
This method will finish up and finalizse the output. Essentially, it does the opposite of the tasks carried out in initiate. In particular: - Ending the root element of the XML document - Ending the XML document - Closing the output stream

Throws:
org.xml.sax.SAXException
java.io.IOException
